subject: Data
title: Cherry-Picking Time Ranges
description: A 60-second lesson on Cherry-Picking Time Ranges.

hook.text: A company shows revenue 'up 30%' â€” but the chart starts in their worst quarter. Coincidence?

buildup.text: Cherry-picking means choosing a start or end date that supports your narrative, ignoring the full picture.

discovery.text: Climate skeptics use this trick constantly â€” picking unusually hot years as baselines to minimize trends.

twist.text: Even honest analysts cherry-pick unknowingly. The dates you choose shape the story the data tells.

climax.text: The antidote: always ask 'what happens if I extend this chart five years in either direction?'

punchline.text: Any trend looks good if you pick the right starting point.

quiz.question: What is cherry-picking in data visualization?
options: Selecting the best data quality sources
Choosing time ranges that support a desired narrative
